course_title: Topics in Afr American Studies: Black Queer Studies
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 4Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: (Black Queer Studies is an interdisciplinary course exploring critical perspectives on  gender, sex, and sexuality in the US and abroad. The course integrates historical and global perspectives bridging African Diaspora Studies, Black Feminism, and Queer Studies. This class will bring together literature, social science, film, art, and include occasional guest speakers. We will work toward a broad definition of queerness to consider various gendered and sexual identities and practices.)
course_description: This course explores one of a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, social and literary texts, and the social sciences.
sections: Class Nbr: 2432, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 6-7:15p, Instructor: A. Chapman, Status: Open
